website_summaries.verdict: We hoped that the Audio-Technica's QuietPoint ATH-ANC7b noise-canceling headphones would deliver more bang for the buck than Bose's noise-canceling models--but they don't.
pros: Less expensive than competing models from Bose
device folds for compact storage in included carrying case
they work (in passive mode) when the noise-canceling function is turned off or the batteries have died
cons: they leak more sound than they should (for a closed-cup design)
they sound only OK for the money

customer_reviews.title: Almost as good as Bose, way cheaper
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I had a chance to compare these to Bose noise-cancelling headphones on a very long international flight. While the Bose are definitely superior, you only notice that you're missing a little extra noise-cancelling once you put the Bose on. To try to quantify, they're about 85% as good at noise cancelling (at 20% of the price!). They also have nice features vs the Bose, such as being able to listen to music without Batteries (although Batteries are required for the noise-cancelling part). Finally, they're more adjustable than the Bose. My wife always complained that the Bose were too big for her head, even on the smallest setting; these, however, fit her perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Brad T

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Rated only a 4 but the product met all of my expectations-not perfect but for the price it can't be beat! My 2nd pair, this one REQUESTED by my wife after trying mine on a long flight. She said she would not fly again without these. A friend also tried mine and has also purchased a pair. The only complaint--the ear cups can become uncomfortable after a while. They could be just a bit larger to prevent this.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great but fragile
customer_reviews.text: These worked great but they are fragile and they broke after 3+ years
customer_reviews.author: Denzel Moten

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Quality
customer_reviews.text: An excellent pair of affordable, high-quality headphones. The noise isolation feature works wonders in my noisy house, and the audio fidelity is the best I've ever experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan E. Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: The noise canceling ability is awesome (especially on planes)
customer_reviews.text: Bought them as a gift for myself and I do not regret. The noise canceling ability is awesome (especially on planes). Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, great sound, handle with care!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are light and cancel outside noise very well. The sound quality and bass is great for the price. These headphones aren't designed to take much abuse so handle them with care.
customer_reviews.author: Maikeru

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are tiny and uncomfortable and the noise cancelling is meh.
customer_reviews.author: seth

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so I could read in peace while my husband watches TV. They worked fairly well for that. Also used them outside when my neighbor was landscaping - blocked out almost all of that. They fit well. For the price, these got the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne F.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: You get what you paid for, bulky and squared but do the job. Had issues with battery compartment, some major brands alkaline cells do not make good contact and power is intermediate. Interestingly the supplied cell did ok might be light length difference on US and China standards. I wish the sound cancelation was more pronounced on airplane cabin noise when in mute setting, but with soundtrack or music they do well. Overall not as happy as I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great. I used it for the first time flying ...
customer_reviews.text: Great. I used it for the first time flying cross country and back. I could hear movies without the whine of the engines. Well worth the money for my infrequent travel.
customer_reviews.author: Barry P.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality to cost
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality and noise cancelling works great in crowded spaces and in airplanes. The cups start to hurt meyears after wearing for a while. Overall good product for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Although these are not the top of the line headphones, the noise-cancelling feature works very well and they were very helpful on a recent airplane trip to greatly reduce the airplane noises. I was even able to fall asleep for part of the journey, which was a first for me! For the price, I don't think you can get much better.
customer_reviews.author: L. Whelan

customer_reviews.title: Returned to Amazon and got Sennheisers that I love and work perfectly
customer_reviews.text: One ear didn't work when I opened it straight out of the box. Returned to Amazon and got Sennheisers that I love and work perfectly instead
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing. Should've listened to reviewers
customer_reviews.text: I disregarded reviews thinking it wouldn't happen to me but sure enough I ordered these and there was no sound in the right speaker straight out of the box. Used them for a few minutes and started hearing a rattling noise in the left speaker. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: YupYup007

customer_reviews.title: OK; not great
customer_reviews.text: Noise cacelling is OK, but not great. Sound is good.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Alterowitz

customer_reviews.title: Too small for my average-size adult ears.
customer_reviews.text: These will only go around smaller-than-average adult ears. They didn't come close to "over the ears" for me so I didn't check out other features. I'm still looking. Update: I ordered Noise Hush and Solitude brands of noise-canceling headsets and gave them a thorough test. Both fit better but they still didn't cover my ears completely. They did fit better over my ear, but not completely. It was very hard to tell which blocked noise better, but I went with the Solitudes. 2015 - Many flights later, they are serving me pretty well. Rick totalbaloney.com
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: and the music sound quality through the headphones is excellent. Obviously they are not as good as a ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for noise cancelling headphones in the $75 range, that has all the features that I want. These appear to fit the bill, they are manufactured by a respected name in the industry, they have large ear coverings, they cancel the ambient noise as advertised, and the music sound quality through the headphones is excellent. Obviously they are not as good as a $400 pair of headphones, but for the price these are quite nice.
customer_reviews.author: Chris King

customer_reviews.title: Works great for loud offices and travelling!
customer_reviews.text: Im a frecuent traveller and also work at a loud office. Only cons: it gets a little hot after a while (not recommended for outdoor/biking/walking, etc) otherwise great
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Garcia

customer_reviews.title: This headphones are comfortable but after a while you can feel a little ...
customer_reviews.text: This headphones are comfortable but after a while you can feel a little body heat increase around the ears. It decrease the disturbing sound of the airplane and still allow you to hear the conversations. The sound is OK when not in the Noise Canceling mode, once using the NC the brightness decreased requiring to equalize to compensate. I had a little issue with the cable because if I plugged it hard to the end it loosed the appropriate contact causing missing sound in one of the sides, but simply by pull the cable a little the problem is solved. Not a big issue.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Estrada

customer_reviews.title: it had good sound and the noise cancelling was solid
customer_reviews.text: Sound in one ear stopped after three months. Otherwise, it had good sound and the noise cancelling was solid.
customer_reviews.author: Vorko

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I chose the over-ear model so that my 4 year old could share with me. Noise cancelling feature was not very good at first and quickly stopped working, just making a staticky white noise when turned on. 47 days later, the right side stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Paul Herrera

customer_reviews.title: nice set
customer_reviews.text: sounds great as long as you have the sound cancellation turned on. turned off the sound is kind of muffled.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Stephens

customer_reviews.title: The sound was bad and one side just broke off while I was ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is rubbish. The sound was bad and one side just broke off while I was listening to it. No stress on it. It just snapped while it was on my head. I tried to get a refund, but Amazon says it is no longer eligible for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Havne't used other noise cancelling devices before so cant compare. Drowns out significant aircraft engine noise but less than hoping. Biggest drawback was a buzzing when nothing no audio is being fed in, doesnt happen all the times. Other reviewers made note of this
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not the best, but good for the price. Blocks noise, especially low frequencies, but not voices, so not so good for concentrating in quiet.
customer_reviews.author: m.s.

customer_reviews.title: The sound is more annoying than the outside noise
customer_reviews.text: These headphones do a fair job of keeping out surrounding noise, but after using them 4 times they developed a very loud scratchy sound when using the quiet setting. The sound is more annoying than the outside noise. I can only use them if the battery is not turned on.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: the headphones worked pretty when you got the cable in just the right ...
customer_reviews.text: the headphones worked pretty when you got the cable in just the right position, otherwise it cut out sound to one side of the headphones. noticed a rattle inside the left cup like a loose screw or broken off plastic bit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The headphones are great.
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are good, especially because I like Audio-Technica products. The headphones reduce 80% of the sounds, more or less. My only complaint is that the pad is small, the specification says that covers the entire ear, but my ear is not completely covered.
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of Bose noise canceling headphones which were awesome. I left them on an airplane and didn't want to pay $300 for a replacement pair. According to reviews, these seemed like decent headphones for the price. After using them on several flights, I agree with that statement. They are not as comfortable as my old Bose, nor do they cancel sound as well or sound as good. But for 1/4 the price of the Bose, I am happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: NOT WIRELESS!
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as wireless. But that means wire can be removed and it will still provide noise reduction. However you can't play music, etc without wire connection.
customer_reviews.author: tpk

customer_reviews.title: Good sound... While it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: The headphones' sound is phenomenal for the price but only when it works. While I can't say I'm truly disappointed with the purchase since the headphones are just about the cheapest option for half-way decent noise cancelling cans, I can say that the quality of the product left much to be desired even at its price point. I used these headphone around 2 months before they gave out, the poor build quality id immediately evident in the details and when the headphone-in jack gave out on them less than 3 months in I was very upset. Compounding onto it about 3 days after the headphone jack
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Lobon

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy
customer_reviews.text: The headset is quite compact for an over-the-ear set but therefore elegant enough. The ear cups are comfort although quite firm. I would like it a little bigger over the head ( I have bigger head than average) but still when I can attach them a way not to be annoying. The active noise cancelling is satisfying for back ground (low frequencies) noise. The other noises are mostly kept away from the over the ear cup. The sound quality very good. I use it in the office and I would certainly recommend it for this kind of use.
customer_reviews.author: Nasos

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my son who has hearing hypersensitivity. The noise cancelling is not as good as my Sennheiser PCX300, but they are a lot more comfortable for his ears. The head piece is nice and sturdy and the availability to detach the headphone cable is a plus. The noise canceling worked quite well during a H.S. Football game. We also watched a video using these headphones and the sound clarity is quite nice. Overall, not a bad purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Giselle

customer_reviews.title: the sound cuts out with movement. even with it ...
customer_reviews.text: the sound cuts out with movement. even with it locked voices cut out... lost the box during a move to az and now stuck with them.
customer_reviews.author: ken J Colgan

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: These pieces of s*** broke within two weeks and now are barely audible.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Zaremba

customer_reviews.title: All sorts of sadness
customer_reviews.text: There are a few things I really don't like about these headphones 1- way too bassy, I feel like my music is just drowning. and it is even worse with the noise cancelling off 2- so cheap! overtime I throw these into my bag I worry they will snap, and taking them out of the carrying pouch is tense because its a tight fit. 3- I bought these for their main feature, noise cancellation, and the cant even do that. I can still here the sounds of the coffee shop or that annoying crying kid on the airplane.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Smeriglio

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these headphones, especially for the price. Unfortunately the pair I received put no sound out at all through the right side. Also, I found the battery compartment very awkward and difficult to open and could not imagine fussing with it on a plane.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Just an advisory
customer_reviews.text: Carefully reviewing all the noise-cancelling headphones. Be careful: Noise "isolation" and "reduction are not noise "cancellation." The former are passive, the latter is active. The ATH-ANC27 comes with a hard sided carrying case. The ATH-ANC27x comes with a pouch. This is the exact same model as the ANC27 according to the manufacturer. Check the Amazon site for more reviews. My only concern is that the device gets rather warm after a few minutes. I'd rather have ear buds but they don't seem to work as well since the bulky padding cuts some of the ambient noise in addition to the microphone. Be sure your battery is fully charged. The headset doesn't provide any noise cancellation when the battery is dead.
customer_reviews.author: Ancient_Fossil

customer_reviews.title: Good value, only fair noise cancellation.
customer_reviews.text: These have a nice warm sound and good bass. For a cheap set, the noise-cancel circuit is decent. They will get uncomfortable after about an hour though, because they are on-ear phones. They also have limited ability to cancel noise since they do not fully cover the ears for average sized humans. They cut out more ambient bass noise than high end. If you are small or have small ears, they may cover your ears.
customer_reviews.author: charles ross

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: I have had these about a month. These headphones sound okay, except only one cup plays sound at a time. The left cup works when the noise canceling is off and the right cup works when the noise canceling is on. Both cups don't play at the same time. The noise canceling seems to help with ambient noise to an extent, but does little for speech. The cups also become painful on my ears after a little while.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M.

customer_reviews.title: Overall not very comfortable and after an hour my ears start to hurt
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is fair; the battery would not get a tight enough connection and, thus the headset turned off intermittently. Had to fix this using tin-foil folded in layers. Overall not very comfortable and after an hour my ears start to hurt. Shopping for a new Bose now. These were inexpensive but don't expect fit/function of high end sets.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wind

customer_reviews.title: Good for a limited time
customer_reviews.text: These were really good for the 1st year I had them. Then thw chord snapped buy Audio Technica's great customer service sent me another one. Now one of the Cans is not as loud and cut in and out...:(
customer_reviews.author: FittyP.

customer_reviews.title: Great budget headset.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift and they really enjoying them. I have used them from time to time and find it has a nice sound. Nice fit on the head as well.
customer_reviews.author: RZB

customer_reviews.title: I love the headphones I just wish the band was a ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the headphones I just wish the band was a bit larger as I have a big head and it gets to be slightly uncomfortable. The only other issue I have is that the right speaker just abruptly stopped playing audio. Don't know what to do as this was a gift and a gift that I'd like to be able to continue using.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Velasco

customer_reviews.title: Where's the Bluetooth???
customer_reviews.text: Good cans, but how about a wireless option (keep the wire connection option too for better fidelity)? Or maybe a (small) adapter that plugs into the jack? A rechargeable battery would be a nice (eco-friendlier) convenient option... What does the x get you anyway?
customer_reviews.author: Phil G.

product_meta.title: Audio-Technica ATH-ANC27X Quiet Point Active Noise-Cancelling Headphones
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Standard PackagingATH-ANC27x QuietPoint active noise-cancelling over-ear headphones offer an outstanding combination of performance, value, comfort and portability. The headphones provide up to 85% noise reduction, and deliver exceptional sound quality with powerful bass, a natural midrange, detailed treble and precise imaging in an immersive sound field. A detachable cord enables their use as cord-free noise-cancelling headphones. The headphones feature cushioned ear pads and a padded adjustable headband for total comfort even during extended wearing. The ATH-ANC27x is ideal for use with portable music and DVD players, in-flight entertainment systems, laptop and desktop computers and many other devices, and is compatible with the Apple iPod, iPhone and iPod touch. The audio functions even if the battery runs down.
feature_bullets: On/Off Switch in ear cup – no external modules

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars69 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
